item.title: Harvist Road/Queens Park, 20th June
item.description:
The red telephone box needs to be investigated immediately. It has nazi graffiti on it and the door doesn't even open. This is beyond unacceptable! Brent Council must take immediate action!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Harvist Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Winchester Avenue/Brondesbury Park, 20th June
item.description:
These white lines must be repainted immediately! While I took these pictures, the car attempted to turn right at this left-turn junction, resulting in a confrontation with the cyclist. This dangerous conflict is a direct result of Brent Councilâ€™s failure to maintain clear road markings! Brent Council must urgently inspect and restore all faded white lines, especially at critical intersections!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Salusbury Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 134 Willesden Lane, 20th June
item.description:
4 bags of trash fly-tipped on the public pavement. It appears highly likely the residents in this property do not have access to appropriate waste disposal which is why this has happened. Brent Council must knock on this door and engage with the residents to prevent this from happening in the future!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Willesden Lane, Kilburn, London
Report on FixMyStreet
